intro: Heterostemma bicanthaceum, commonly known as the two-curved horned plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
